{
    "number": 217990,
    "data": "1,2,5,10,17,26,37,50,65,82,101,122,145,170,197,226,257,290,420",
    "name": "Size of largest semigroup generated by one boolean n X n matrix.",
    "reference": [
        "J. Denes, K. H. Kim, and F. W. Roush, Automata on one symbol, in Studies in Pure Mathematics: To the Memory of Paul Turan, Birkhauser, 1983, pp. 127-134."
    ],
    "link": [
        "George Markowsky, <a href=\"https://eudml.org/doc/134218\">Bounds on the index and period of a binary relation on a finite set</a>, Semigroup Forum 13 (1977), 253-259."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "For n < 19, a(n) = n^2 - 2n + 2.  For large n, l(n) <= a(n) < n^2 - 2n + 2 + l(n), where l(n) is Landau's function (A000793).  It seems the exact value is still unknown."
    ],
    "example": [
        "a(4) = 10: the matrix [[0,0,0,1], [0,0,1,0], [1,0,0,0], [0,1,1,0]] generates a semigroup of order 10 under boolean matrix multiplication."
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A000793, A202140."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,hard,more",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Jeffrey Shallit_, Oct 17 2012",
    "references": 0,
    "revision": 16,
    "time": "2016-11-28T12:35:35-05:00",
    "created": "2012-10-17T13:30:05-04:00"
}
